column2: OREGON DMV TEST
Question Text
1. To avoid the risk of being involved in an alcohol-related crash, you should:
column4: say “No, thanks" if someone offers you alcohol.
column6: call a taxi if you've been drinking.
column8: decide before you start drinking that you are not going to drive.

column2: 2. This sign means:
column4: There is a traffic signal ahead

column2: 3. What is the first thing you should do if your wheels move off the pavement?
column4: Try pumping the gas pedal to increase pressure.
column6: Pull over to the right and sound your horn to warn the other drivers.
column10: Ease your foot off the gas pedal and brake gently.

column2: 4. A driver cuts off another vehicle, or threatens another motorist or a pedestrian. These are examples of:
5. An edge line that angles toward the center of the road indicates that:
6. Speed limit signs are:
7. _______ are required to wear safety belts.
8. These are:
9. Where must you position your vehicle when you prepare to make a left turn from a two-way roadway into a one-way roadway?
column4: As far to the right as possible.
column6: As close as possible to the center line.

column2: 10. You can reduce the chance of a collision with a large vehicle if you:
column4: cut abruptly in front of it.
column8: pay close attention to the turn signals.
column10: pull in front of the large vehicle before you can see the whole front of the vehicle in your mirror.

column2: 11. This road sign means:
column4: Winding road ahead; slow down to the indicated speed
column6: Merge, then slow down to the safe speed indicated
column8: The road ahead curves right; slow down to indicated speed
column10: Divided highway begins. Slow down to the safe speed indicated

column2: 12. What does this sign indicate?
13. When driving on a wet road:
column4: as you drive faster, your tires may lose traction.
column6: you must be aware that the pavement gets even more slippery when it's been raining for long periods of time.
column8: you should follow the vehicle ahead of you more closely.
column10: as you decrease your speed, the road becomes more slippery.

column2: 14. When you prepare to make a left turn from a one-way road into a two-way road, you must:
column4: approach the turn in the right lane or from the right side of a single lane.
column6: approach the turn in the left lane or from the left side of a single lane.
column8: enter the two-way road to the left of its center line.

column2: 15. This sign means:
column6: The traffic signal is not operational

column2: 16. You may not pass another vehicle on either side of a _______ centerline.
17. What is the most important rule to remember in any emergency?
18. This road sign means:
column10: Divided highway ahead - stay to the right

column2: 19. If you crash and you do not have liability insurance:
column4: your driving privileges will be revoked for two years.
column8: your driving privileges will be suspended for one year.

column2: 20. This road sign means:
21. If your gas pedal is stuck, you should:
column4: ease your foot off the gas pedal and brake gently.
column6: try pumping it to increase pressure.
column8: hook your shoe under the pedal and see if you can free it. If not, shift into neutral and use the brake to slow your vehicle and get off the road.
column10: turn off the ignition if your vehicle has power steering.

column2: 22. This sign means:
column6: Narrow bridge ahead. Slow down and drive with caution.
column8: Do not to enter if your vehicle is taller than the height listed on the sign.

column2: 23. A red traffic sign means?
24. This road sign means:
25. _________________ your mirrors when you prepare to change lanes.
column10: It is not recommended to check

column2: 26. Your first response to reduced visibility should be:
column4: to turn on your windshield wipers.
column8: to look for road edge markings to guide you.

column2: 27. When changing lanes, you should not:
column6: use the inside rearview mirror to check for blind spots
column8: check to see if other drivers are moving into the same lane.
column10: check your side and rear view mirrors.

column2: 28. Your brake lights tell other drivers that you:
29. When they see this sign, drivers should:
column4: be ready to shift to lower gear.
column6: yield to trucks coming from the hill on the right.
column8: be ready to brake sharply and stop.

column2: 30. When driving in bad weather, drivers should:
column6: increase their speed to get to their destination more quickly.

column2: 31. When following motorcycles, drivers should:
column4: keep more space in front of their vehicle.
column6: keep less space in front of their vehicle.
column8: try to pass them as they have different braking capabilities than other motor vehicles.

column2: 32. This road sign means:
column6: Lane reduction - the right lane ends soon
column8: Lane reduction - the left lane ends soon

column2: 33. When driving on wet roads, you should remember:
column4: to stay farther behind the vehicle ahead of you.
column6: driving on wet roads can cause hydroplaning.
column8: you should give yourself additional time to stop.

column2: 34. This road sign warns drivers that:
column4: they are coming to a point where another traffic lane joins the one they are on.
column6: the one-way street or roadway is about to change to two-way traffic.

column2: 35. To reduce the risk of being involved in a crash, drivers should:
column4: ignore other drivers on the road.
column6: drive on side streets and back roads whenever possible.
column10: communicate with other drivers on the road.
